instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Hi i am practice on an old board a 820-2877-b, with damage from liquid, the board goes to S0, but no fan spin 
PP5V_S0 = OK
PP3V3_S0 = OK
PP1V8_S0 = 0K
PP1V5_S0 = OK
CPUVCORE = 0
ONLY WITH RESET SMC STARTS

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Do you really mean SMC reset, or just pressing power button?
Nvidia MCP platform boards don't start without pressing power button, as normal.

Post voltage for L7560, L7620 and L7710.

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
you have to excuse me, I meant that if I do the reset procedure the smc starts with the fan at maximum.

L7560 = 0.022
L7620= 1.080
L7710= 0

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
"starts with the fan at maximum"
Do you mean SMC bypass maybe.
Board doesn't turn on in normal mode?

Post basic voltages for U7500; pins 14, 16, 22, 29.

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
yes, in fact I said I am a beginner, then these are the measures of u 7500:
14 = 12.55
16 = 5.044
22 = 5.018
29 = 3.303

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: Post resistance to ground at L7560 (ohm scale).

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
016.0 [URL='http://it.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CE%A9']Ω[/URL]
Is there low insulation?

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: Where did you find liquid spill?

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: Yes, the part was affected by oxidation

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: Which areas have been affected by corrosion???

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: Side A from the LVDS connector up to u7500 side B smc the circuit of the 3V42 etc. I removed it with some isopropyl alcohol, I rebuilt tracks on Q5315 and I also replaced it, and it works now I agree on U7500 I see if any capacitor pulls down, do you think I have to replace U7500?

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Replace C7564 and R7565; check their traces too.
May need to replace U7500 and Q7560/65; better at same time.

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: I replaced resistance and capacitor but nothing, I did a test with isopropyl alcohol on Q7560/65 and Q7565 heat evaporates fast I'm afraid it pulls down

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
16 ohm doesn't look low for MCP core voltage.
Post resistance to ground at L6995 (ohm scale).

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Check all the components related with U7500 area.
Pay atention to traces continuity.

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
I removed the U7500 I realized that there is an interruption on pad 14 or the PPBUS_G3H pro pad to rebuild it and let's see what happens
But the question that arises is: did it stop by corrosion or why did the U 7500 go short?

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: [ATTACH type="full"]60241[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Where did you see short?

Looks like fault caused by corrosion...

threads.title: 820-2877 Liquid Damage
threads.message: If I hadn't removed the U7500 I would never have noticed the interruption, I rebuilt the missing part now it works perfectly. It was very informative. Thank you!
